Happy to share more—thanks for considering Nursery_A so seriously.

1) **Class size & ratio**: Our class is kept intentionally small. Typical enrollment is **around 10–14 children**, with **2 core educators** in the room most of the day (and additional support during peak transition times when available). We aim to keep the day-to-day experience feeling calm and well-supervised, especially during arrival, outdoor time, and lunch/rest.

2) **Social-emotional support & transitions**: We use a consistent routine and clear cues (visual schedules, predictable “next steps,” and transition songs/phrases). If anything needs attention (sleep changes, biting/hitting patterns, toileting, separation anxiety), we message promptly and set up a quick call or meeting rather than letting it linger.

**Strong-fit qualities/circumstances** we see most often:
- Families who value a **play-based, relationship-centered** approach (and are comfortable with learning happening through play and routines).
- Openness to **two-way communication** and consistency between home and school (especially around sleep, toileting, and behavior support).
- Willingness to collaborate during the first few weeks on **transition strategies**.
